intro: Nardophyllum bracteolatum, commonly known as the bract-leaved nard plant, is a member of the Papaveraceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky or alpine environments. The plant features showy, yellowish-orange flowers with five petals and a distinctive, spurred structure. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered in a dense layer of hairs. Nardophyllum bracteolatum is known for its aromatic properties and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
